text:
Created attachment 33370
trunk patch

There are various examples of how to generate the SHA1 string in different languages.  There is no example for Python.

The attached patches add the Python example for the 2.4 branch and trunk.  I'm happy to backport this to 2.2 if it will be used.

creator: covener@gmail.com
text: Thanks for the improvements, committed to trunk and 2.4
Given the state of SHA1 in the browser world, shouldn't all examples be changed to show a SHA256 string?
creator: tom.browder@gmail.com

text:
(In reply to Tom Browder from comment #3)
> Given the state of SHA1 in the browser world, shouldn't all examples be
> changed to show a SHA256 string?

I don't think it's (directly) applicable to deprecation of SHA1 in certificate signatures.  In the case of this doc, the browser never creates or checks the hash, they're generally sending base64 encoded passwords.
